alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 26 at 3:27PM EDT until April 26 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHATHAM COUNTY... At 327 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pooler, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Pooler, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Bloomingdale, Meinhard, and Monteith. This warning includes the following interstates: I-16 between mile markers 151 and 158. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 101 and 109. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
